ratings.comment: I skipped 90% of his lectures and got an A because statistics and math comes pretty naturally to me. My friends who struggle with math went to every lecture and bombed his exams. What I'm saying is, he does not actually teach you, he derives a couple equations for you that you need to learn how to use on your own. Definitely the worst Genetics prof

Definitely not a class you want to take if you're not passionate about genetics. Dr. Engels is great at giving you outside resources compared to some professors in the department. Online quizzes every week are pretty easy, and he gives you specific practice problems for them. Haven't touched the book since he started teaching and am doing great!

Provides clear and insightful explanations of the statistical and mathematical theories of genetic logic. Anyone who wishes to equip themselves with the tools needed for genetic analysis will value Prof. Engels lectures.
Avoid! Worst class ever! I studied around 4 hours a day including weekends and did extremely poor.

Your whole grade is determined by an online math quiz. If you typed one wrong number into your calculator, you got the whole problem wrong. This entire class was extremely discouraging. Super hard work will get you at best a B. Don't take this class unless you have to for your major.

Cares less about the class than the students, solely a teacher so he can do research. He is of zero help and is socially inept and seems to not want students to succeed. Avoid at all cost. I seriously mean don't take the class if engels OR laughon are teaching it. It will be near impossible to get above a B.

LITERALLY did ALL i could, and had D, was forced to drop. This class is NOT for people who has no prior knowledge or else you will just end up feeling dumb and unqualified for college. Exams are broken into weekly Online quizzes. 10,20,30,40 pts each. ONLINE meaning there is NO room for error or miscalculations. GOOD LUCK if you have to take it.

I have never encountered a worse professor on this campus. Does not speak coherently, socially inept, and just doesn't care about student success. Quizzes were ridiculously hard, practice problems were nothing like quiz questions. AVOID THIS MAN LIKE THE PLAGUE. He will ruin your semester. Absolute torcher

His slides are very elaborate and well put together, but he doesn't do a good job of explaining things. We had weekly quizzes instead of exams, but they are near impossible. Quiz questions are a lot harder than the practice problems or examples from lecture. Some of the TAs didn't even know what was going on. Avoid taking him at all costs.
Lecture slides/audios are all on-line - you don't really have to go to lectures. Doable on-line quizzes. Take him

He goes really fast and tries to get multiple lectures AHEAD so he can quiz us on more information at once. His quizzes for his part of the class were not cohesive with the practice problems he gave us, so you had no clue what was coming..

If you have an intuition for math, the material in Engels' part of the course isn't that bad.  Class averages were around 60% and 70% for his exams, which the curve makes a C.  Exams are also online for his half of the course, so you can use your notes.  Much better professor than Laughon.  Posts lecture audio and powerpoints online.

Professor Engels was probably one of the worst professors that I've come across.  His exams are beasically: work out a hard stats problem related to genetics, round your answer to the nearest whole number, and answer the whole number 0-9 on the answer sheet.  Yeah, this is the only class I got a C in.  He went too fast and expected no one to pass.

This is a very difficult class to begin with. I don't think anyone should walk into it and expect to get an A without working extremely hard. Bill Engels taught the probability section, which is not my strong suit. However if you pay attention, ask him questions, and do the bookwork you have nothing to worry about. Parts 3&4 were easier for me.

Yes, this class is hard. If you have no propensity for statistics (as I expect is true a lot of bio majors) this is going to be very hard for you. But, if you're pretty good at math and very good at studying, you won't fail like everyone is telling you. He goes through everything you need to know and posts his lectures online.

Do everything in your power to avoid this class. If you have any other options to complete major requirements, take them; if genetics is your major and you have to take it, change majors. This class really is that awful. Exams are insanely hard, the curve (if it exists) is unforgiving and the TAs try but more often then not they aren't helpful.

Do NOT take him for 466. This class is difficult and poorly taught no matter who you have, but he enjoys degrading students. His exams are ridiculous, our first was a 45% avg. which he left as a D & he was disappointed in us-but don't you think that reflects on his poor teaching?!He refuses to make his little video/audio lectures available to print
Completely insane exams all the bad things you've heard are correct.  Avoid this class with him at all costs.

Probably the worst professor i've ever had (i'm not even kidding) His exams are crazy hard! The average on exams are not even 50%. I got a D in his class and I'm not a D student. PLEASE do not take 466 with Engles as your professor, If someone had warn me that it only gets worst after exam 1, i would've dropped.

Multiple choice exams for MATH. Fill in the number in the 10s place of your answer. NOT a way to go for a math exam. Round wrong and you're screwed. Discouraging. EVERYONE wanted to give up after the 1st exam (average of 20). Was really interesting up until the 1st exams. exams purposefully made difficult. Good luck!
